comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,125 @@
+// Copyright (c) HashiCorp, Inc.
+// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1
+
+package ratelimit
+
+import (
+	"errors"
+	"fmt"
+	"net/http"
+	"regexp"
+
+	"github.com/hashicorp/boundary/internal/types/action"
+	"github.com/hashicorp/boundary/internal/types/resource"
+	rate "github.com/hashicorp/go-rate"
+)
+
+var pathRegex = regexp.MustCompile(`/v1/(?P<resource>[\w-]+)(/(?P<id>\w+)(:(?P<action>[\w-]+)?)?)?`)
+
+func extractResourceAction(path, method string) (res, act string, err error) {
+	var id string
+
+	// TODO: replace regex with lexer
+	match := pathRegex.FindStringSubmatch(path)
+	for i, name := range pathRegex.SubexpNames() {
+		switch name {
+		case "resource":
+			res = match[i]
+			r, ok := resource.FromPlural(res)
+			if !ok {
+				res = resource.Unknown.String()
+				err = fmt.Errorf("unknown resource")
+			} else {
+				res = r.String()
+			}
+		case "action":
+			act = match[i]
+			if act != "" {
+				_, ok := action.Map[act]
+				if !ok {
+					act = action.Unknown.String()
+					err = fmt.Errorf("unknown action")
comment.body: How about returning a `400 Bad Request` since the action is unknown?

pull_request.title: Rate limit thin line
pull_request.body:
This adds the remaining pieces to complete a thin line for applying rate
limits to the controller api:

1. Adds an http middleware handler function to check and apply the
  limits. This middleware is added to the controller's API handler
  functions to check if a request is allowed by a rate.Limiter prior to
  processing the request.
2. Adds a rate.Limiter to the controller. This is initialized by
   generating a slice of rate.Limits from the ratelimit.Config provided
   on the Controller's config.

I am just opening this as a draft since there are several outstanding
things:

1. I still don't like some of the naming for the access to the action
   registrar. So any suggestions there are welcome.
2. In registering actions for each resource, I discovered a variety of
   ways the actions get defined and used in the app services. See
   b35da8fc2 for more details.  I think this can be cleaned up, but that
   might come later after more of the rate limiting functionality is
   done.
3. Additional tests need to be added in a number of places.

repo.name: boundary
repo.description: Boundary enables identity-based access management for dynamic infrastructure.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,125 @@
+// Copyright (c) HashiCorp, Inc.
+// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1
+
+package ratelimit
+
+import (
+	"errors"
+	"fmt"
+	"net/http"
+	"regexp"
+
+	"github.com/hashicorp/boundary/internal/types/action"
+	"github.com/hashicorp/boundary/internal/types/resource"
+	rate "github.com/hashicorp/go-rate"
+)
+
+var pathRegex = regexp.MustCompile(`/v1/(?P<resource>[\w-]+)(/(?P<id>\w+)(:(?P<action>[\w-]+)?)?)?`)
+
+func extractResourceAction(path, method string) (res, act string, err error) {
+	var id string
+
+	// TODO: replace regex with lexer
+	match := pathRegex.FindStringSubmatch(path)
+	for i, name := range pathRegex.SubexpNames() {
+		switch name {
+		case "resource":
+			res = match[i]
+			r, ok := resource.FromPlural(res)
+			if !ok {
+				res = resource.Unknown.String()
+				err = fmt.Errorf("unknown resource")
+			} else {
+				res = r.String()
+			}
+		case "action":
+			act = match[i]
+			if act != "" {
+				_, ok := action.Map[act]
+				if !ok {
+					act = action.Unknown.String()
+					err = fmt.Errorf("unknown action")
+				}
+			}
+		case "id":
+			id = match[i]
+		}
+	}
+
+	switch act {
+	case "":
+		switch id {
+		case "":
+			switch method {
+			case http.MethodGet:
+				act = action.List.String()
+			case http.MethodPost:
+				act = action.Create.String()
+			default:
+				act = action.Unknown.String()
+				err = fmt.Errorf("unknown action")
+			}
+		default:
+			switch method {
+			case http.MethodGet:
+				act = action.Read.String()
+			case http.MethodDelete:
+				act = action.Delete.String()
+			case http.MethodPut:
+				act = action.Update.String()
+			default:
+				act = action.Unknown.String()
+				err = fmt.Errorf("unknown action")
+			}
+		}
+	}
+	return
+}
+
+// Handler is an http middleware handler that checks if a request is allowed
+// using the provided rate limiter. If the request is allowed, the next handler
+// is called. Otherwise a 429 is returned with the Retry-After response header
+// set to the number of seconds the client should wait to make it's next request.
+func Handler(l *rate.Limiter, next http.Handler) http.Handler {
+	return http.HandlerFunc(func(rw http.ResponseWriter, req *http.Request) {
+		path := req.URL.Path
+		method := req.Method
+
+		res, a, err := extractResourceAction(path, method)
+		if err != nil {
+			// TODO: what to do here?
+			// We could:
+			// 1. Bail early and block the request, but this prevents our existing
+			//    logic from running and presumably returning a 404.
+			// 2. Just skip doing rate limiting and call the next handler.
+			//    Since the controller *should* just 404, it is probably ok to allow
+			//    the request and not worry about limiting it.
+			// 3. Have a fall-back resource/action (i.e. resource.Unknown/action.Unknown)
+			//    and apply a rate limit to it just like any other resource+action pair.
+			//    This might be best, since it allows for limiting even invalid requests.
+			//    But we would need to document this Unknown case. If this is the case,
+			//    We should probably have extractResource always return a resource+action,
+			//    and not return an error.
+			rw.WriteHeader(http.StatusNotFound)
+			return
+		}
+
+		allowed, quota, err := l.Allow(res, a)
+		if err != nil && !errors.Is(err, rate.ErrLimiterFull) {
+			// TODO: what to do here?
+			// The only other error here should be rate.ErrLimitNotFound, which
+			// shouldn't be possible given how we initialize the limiter,
+			// so perhaps a 500 makes sense?
+			rw.WriteHeader(http.StatusInternalServerError)
comment.body:
What about `503 Service Unavailable`?

> Common causes are a server that is down for maintenance or that is overloaded. This response should be used for temporary conditions and the [Retry-After](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Retry-After) HTTP header should, if possible, contain the estimated time for the recovery of the service.

pull_request.title: Rate limit thin line
pull_request.body:
This adds the remaining pieces to complete a thin line for applying rate
limits to the controller api:

1. Adds an http middleware handler function to check and apply the
  limits. This middleware is added to the controller's API handler
  functions to check if a request is allowed by a rate.Limiter prior to
  processing the request.
2. Adds a rate.Limiter to the controller. This is initialized by
   generating a slice of rate.Limits from the ratelimit.Config provided
   on the Controller's config.

I am just opening this as a draft since there are several outstanding
things:

1. I still don't like some of the naming for the access to the action
   registrar. So any suggestions there are welcome.
2. In registering actions for each resource, I discovered a variety of
   ways the actions get defined and used in the app services. See
   b35da8fc2 for more details.  I think this can be cleaned up, but that
   might come later after more of the rate limiting functionality is
   done.
3. Additional tests need to be added in a number of places.

pull_request.body:
This adds the remaining pieces to complete a thin line for applying rate
limits to the controller api:

1. Adds an http middleware handler function to check and apply the
  limits. This middleware is added to the controller's API handler
  functions to check if a request is allowed by a rate.Limiter prior to
  processing the request.
2. Adds a rate.Limiter to the controller. This is initialized by

I am just opening this as a draft since there are several outstanding

1. I still don't like some of the naming for the access to the action
   registrar. So any suggestions there are welcome.
2. In registering actions for each resource, I discovered a variety of
   ways the actions get defined and used in the app services. See
   b35da8fc2 for more details.  I think this can be cleaned up, but that
   might come later after more of the rate limiting functionality is
   done.
3. Additional tests need to be added in a number of places.

pull_request.title: Rate limit thin line
pull_request.body:
This adds the remaining pieces to complete a thin line for applying rate
limits to the controller api:

1. Adds an http middleware handler function to check and apply the
  limits. This middleware is added to the controller's API handler
  functions to check if a request is allowed by a rate.Limiter prior to
  processing the request.
2. Adds a rate.Limiter to the controller. This is initialized by
   generating a slice of rate.Limits from the ratelimit.Config provided
   on the Controller's config.

I am just opening this as a draft since there are several outstanding
things:

1. I still don't like some of the naming for the access to the action
   registrar. So any suggestions there are welcome.
2. In registering actions for each resource, I discovered a variety of
   ways the actions get defined and used in the app services. See
   b35da8fc2 for more details.  I think this can be cleaned up, but that
   might come later after more of the rate limiting functionality is
   done.
3. Additional tests need to be added in a number of places.

pull_request.title: Rate limit thin line
pull_request.body:
This adds the remaining pieces to complete a thin line for applying rate
limits to the controller api:

1. Adds an http middleware handler function to check and apply the
  limits. This middleware is added to the controller's API handler
  functions to check if a request is allowed by a rate.Limiter prior to
  processing the request.
2. Adds a rate.Limiter to the controller. This is initialized by
   generating a slice of rate.Limits from the ratelimit.Config provided
   on the Controller's config.

I am just opening this as a draft since there are several outstanding
things:

1. I still don't like some of the naming for the access to the action
   registrar. So any suggestions there are welcome.
2. In registering actions for each resource, I discovered a variety of
   ways the actions get defined and used in the app services. See
   b35da8fc2 for more details.  I think this can be cleaned up, but that
   might come later after more of the rate limiting functionality is
   done.
3. Additional tests need to be added in a number of places.

+// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1
+
+package action
+
+import (
+	"fmt"
+	"sync"
+
+	"github.com/hashicorp/boundary/internal/types/resource"
+)
+
+type resourceActionSets struct {
+	individual ActionSet
+	collection ActionSet
+	valid      ActionSet
+}
+
+type byResource struct {
+	mu sync.RWMutex
+	m  map[resource.Type]*resourceActionSets
+}
+
+func (b *byResource) add(r resource.Type, individual ActionSet, collection ActionSet) error {
+	b.mu.Lock()
+	defer b.mu.Unlock()
+
+	if b.m == nil {
+		b.m = make(map[resource.Type]*resourceActionSets)
+	}
+
+	_, ok := b.m[r]
+	if ok {
+		return fmt.Errorf("%s already registered", r)
+	}
+	b.m[r] = &resourceActionSets{
+		individual: individual,
+		collection: collection,
+		valid:      append(individual, collection...),
+	}
+
+	return nil
+}
+
+func (b *byResource) get(r resource.Type) (*resourceActionSets, error) {
+	b.mu.RLock()
+	defer b.mu.RUnlock()
+	a, ok := b.m[r]
+	if !ok {
+		return nil, fmt.Errorf("resource not found: %s", r)
+	}
+	return a, nil
+}
+
+var byResourceRegistrar = &byResource{}
+
+// RegisterResource registers the valid ActionSets for a resource.
+func RegisterResource(r resource.Type, individual ActionSet, collection ActionSet) error {
+	return byResourceRegistrar.add(r, individual, collection)
+}
+
+// SetForResource returns the valid ActionSet for the given resource.
+// If the provided resource was not registered, and error is returned.

pull_request.title: Rate limit thin line
pull_request.body:
This adds the remaining pieces to complete a thin line for applying rate
limits to the controller api:

1. Adds an http middleware handler function to check and apply the
  limits. This middleware is added to the controller's API handler
  functions to check if a request is allowed by a rate.Limiter prior to
  processing the request.
2. Adds a rate.Limiter to the controller. This is initialized by
   generating a slice of rate.Limits from the ratelimit.Config provided
   on the Controller's config.

I am just opening this as a draft since there are several outstanding
things:

1. I still don't like some of the naming for the access to the action
   registrar. So any suggestions there are welcome.
2. In registering actions for each resource, I discovered a variety of
   ways the actions get defined and used in the app services. See
   b35da8fc2 for more details.  I think this can be cleaned up, but that
   might come later after more of the rate limiting functionality is
   done.
3. Additional tests need to be added in a number of places.

repo.name: boundary
repo.description: Boundary enables identity-based access management for dynamic infrastructure.
